etymologies: Middle English: from Old French violette, diminutive of viole, from Latin viola ‘violet’

definitions: a herbaceous plant of temperate regions, typically having purple, blue, or white five-petaled flowers, one of which forms a landing pad for pollinating insects.

notes.text: Genus Viola, family Violaceae (the violet family): many species, including the dog violet and sweet violet. See also viola

definitions: used in names of similar-flowered plants of other families, e.g. African violet.
shortDefinitions: used in names of similar-flowered plants of other families

definitions: a bluish-purple color seen at the end of the spectrum opposite red

examples.text: a beautiful blue with a tinge of violet

shortDefinitions: bluish-purple colour seen at end of spectrum opposite red

examples.text: her almost violet eyes were a bit startling
